title: Tension Grows Between U.S. And Venezuela
teaser: Venezuela has announced that Americans will now have to pay for travel visas to enter the country.
contentencoded:
If you’re traveling to Venezuela, you’d better get a visa. Although this is not a top travel destination for many Americans, this week Venezuela has announced that Americans will now have to pay for travel visas to enter the country.

This comes after the country’s president Nicolas Maduro announced that he would also like to see the number ofÂ employees in the U.S. embassy reduced by 80 percent, to resemble the number of Venezuelan diplomatic staff in the U.S.

What brought about all this tension? Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson talks to Brian Ellsworth, senior correspondent for Reuters in Caracas, about the changes in the economically unstable country.

Guest

  • Brian Ellsworth, senior correspondent for Reuters in Caracas. He tweets @brianpablo10.
